answers.answer: Did you have your sugar test done ? Diabetes usually causes insatiable thirst. It could also be hormones. Talk to your OB.
Hormones make more sense cause they been all out of wack with this baby I had the sugar test done when I was 7 months  everything was ok
Do you have MS by chance?
I have become very thirsty as well idk if its because of the weather or me. I know how you feel

MS is multiple sclerosis.... nasty degenerative disease... I can tell you dont have it because you would know the initals of it... I know gestational diabetes you have an insatiable thirst-- I know I do at 33 weeks.. but you could also be getting sick?? I just caught the bug going around and I am less than pleased about it.. and its making me even more thirsty.... hoping this Tylenol will kick in and allow me to sleep... also try drinking milk... it coats the throat longer
I saw your screen name and thought you had MS as well had nothing to do with your thirst.

question: Im constantly getting thirsty every 5 minutes im drinking water but its not helping the closer I get to my due date the worst it get especially at night my other two pregnancies I was thirsty alot in the beginning im 38 weeks n 5 days I wonder is it a sign of labor cause im just finding out diarrhea is a sign
title: thirsty
